abstract: Delphi Lodge salmon hatchery on Ireland's northwest coast releases 50,000 smolts each year, of which perhaps 1,500 return as adults; hatchery fish have their adipose fin clipped and anglers catching such a fish must not release it; fish have to be killed to prevent interbreeding with natural wild salmon.
snippet: Delphi Lodge, which got into the hatchery business in 1990, releases 50,000 smolts each year, of which perhaps 1,500 return as adults.
lead_paragraph: Delphi Lodge, which got into the hatchery business in 1990, releases 50,000 smolts each year, of which perhaps 1,500 return as adults.

headline.main: Appetite for Catch and Release Is Tempered
headline.seo: Appetite For Catch And Release Tempered at Delphi Lodge
